headline: Stock futures slump as U.S.-Europe trade tensions ramp up over Trump’s Greenland demands
summary: Wall Street braced for losses when regular trading resumes Tuesday, as U.S. stock futures fell over the holiday weekend following President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats against Europe.

headline: Here are the 3 big things we're watching in the stock market in the week ahead
summary: The earnings calendar is filled with industry bellwethers ranging from 3M to GE Aerospace.

headline: Jerome Powell will attend Supreme Court hearing on Lisa Cook’s firing
summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who has been a target of the Trump administration, is showing a sign of unity with another central-bank member.

headline: My sister is buying our parents’ $3 million house, but wants to deduct $100K for renovations. Who’s right?
summary: “If she didn’t want the home, it would have been sold at fair market value.”

headline: Trump is going to Davos — here are the big names who aren't
summary: A who's who of heads of state, top CEOs and tech pioneers are landing in Davos for the 2026 World Economic Forum meeting. But some big names aren't going.

headline: Global industrial stocks feel the benefit of the biggest hedge fund buying in ten years
summary: Improved forecasts for global growth, a decent IP print  and the rearmament in Europe are all   encouraging hedge funds to overweight the industrial sector.

headline: This strategist and longstanding bitcoin bull exits his position and switches allegiance to gold
summary: Chris Wood’s “Greed and Fear” investment letter discussed the threat posed by quantum computers and exited his bitcoin position as a consequence.

headline: 'PTO-maxxing' is the key to making the most of your time off in 2026—here's how to do it
summary: PTO-maxxing involves tacking vacation days onto holidays and weekends to maximize time off. Here's how it works and other tips for making the most of your PTO.

headline: 65% of workers are interested in 'microshifting' their schedules as an alternative to the strict 9-to-5: It's 'a way to reclaim control'
summary: Some workers who have soured on the 9-to-5 schedule are interested in trying "microshifting," which may offer greater flexibility and control over their time.

headline: Trump’s latest E.U. tariff threats may spur more investors away from the ‘buy America’ trade, analysts say
summary: Some are watching for a “weaponization of capital,” and moves into some Europe stocks — and away from the dollar — amid fresh U.S. tariffs threats against Europe.

headline: The top 3 red flags job seekers should watch out for in interviews, says career expert: 'You'll want to run for the door'
summary: These interview red flags could be the first sign of a toxic workplace, says career expert.

headline: Business air travel is back, and that’s good news for this arline
summary: United is seen reporting higher revenue in a quarter marred by the U.S. government shutdown. An uptick in  business travel is a welcome boost for the year ahead.

headline: As competition heats up, OpenAI changes course and introduces ads on ChatGPT
summary: Confronted with fierce competition from its rivals and immense funding requirements in the next few years, Altman announced ads on ChatGPT.

headline: A year after his death, Gene Hackman’s longtime Santa Fe home is listed for $6.25 million
summary: Actor Gene Hackman’s longtime New Mexico compound has hit the market, a year after he and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, were found dead inside the home.

headline: Stock futures lead global markets sharply lower and gold hits fresh record as Trump threatens tariffs on Europe over Greenland
summary: Concerns European nations will retaliate raises fears of more trade turmoil
